page.title: 18 SHOPPING IN LEWES
page.content: Antique shops represent 20% of non-food shops in historic Lewes. Cul- verwells, Harper & Eede's, Curtis & Co and Stevensons have supplied local farmers for many years from thjis market town. Many Lewesians go to Brighton or Eastbourne for clothes and shoes, but you can buy these here in small shops. Safeway's Foodstore opened in l982 employing l37, serving 25000 shoppers a week,competing with other foodshops It is quite a meetingplace for Lewes, including Boot Sales in its carpark. Cliffe High Street may become a pedestrian precinct, and shops are optimistically opening on the Odeon site at its eastern end. Railway Land development will strengthen the shop- ping pull of this end of Lewes. More High Street shops may move downhill to the lower end of Lewes as a result.
